item.title: CMolieri add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "I will not have my life narrowed down. I will not bow down to somebody else's whim or to someone else's ignorance." -- bell hooks

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by Bayard Rustin
item.description: "When an individual is protesting society's refusal to acknowledge his dignity as a human being, his very act of protest confers dignity on him." -- Bayard Rustin

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "An unbelieved truth can hurt a man much more than a lie. It takes great courage to back truth unacceptable to our times. There's a punishment for it, and it's usually crucifixion." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It would be absurd if we did not understand both angels and devils, since we invented them." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "People like you to be something, preferably what they are." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "A man so painfully in love is capable of self-torture beyond belief." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "My imagination will get me a passport to hell one day." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It seems to me that if you or I must choose between two courses of thought or action, we should remember our dying and try so to live that our death brings no pleasure to the world." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There's more beauty in truth, even if it is dreadful beauty." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I believe that there is one story in the world, and only one. . . . Humans are caught—in their lives, in their thoughts, in their hungers and ambitions, in their avarice and cruelty, and in their kindness and generosity too—in a net of good and evil. . . . There is no other story. A man, after he has brushed off the dust and chips of his life, will have left only the hard, clean questions: Was it good or was it evil? Have I done well—or ill?" -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And this I believe: that the free, exploring mind of the individual human is the most valuable thing in the world. And this I would fight for: the freedom of the mind to take any direction it wishes, undirected. And this I must fight against: any idea, religion, or government which limits or destroys the individual. This is what I am and what I am about." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And now that you don't have to be perfect, you can be good." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All great and precious things are lonely." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: CMolieri add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible." -- John Steinbeck
